attributes.action: Introduce a law on animal Medication advice and distribution
attributes.background: We want to change advice owners get from their vets in the UK with regards purchasing medication for their animals and introduce a statutory prescription charge. Many owners do not know that they can purchase a written prescription from the vet and get the medication from a pharmacy at reduced price
attributes.additional_details:
The reason we are petitioning for a change is that many owners cannot afford the medication charges from the vets especially for long term conditions and face the hard decision to put their pets to sleep, giving their pets up to animal welfare organisations or worse abandoning their pet. Prescription charges range from £8.00 to £15.00 depending on which vet you use.
With Blu's Law we would reduce the amount of abandoned animals and animals put to sleep needlessly.

attributes.action: Petition for a vote of no confidence in Parliament against the Prime Minister
attributes.background: no background except to bring the Prime Minister to account for his actions over the EU renegotiation

attributes.action: Reduce the ielts score for English born nurses who completed nursing outside EU
attributes.background:
I was born & school/colleged in the UK, then travelled to NZ in 2004 & completed my nursing degree & worked in Emergency. I am now struggling to come back & work in the UK due to british council requirements of the ielts score of 7 which has nothing to do with Nursing! 
Please sign if you agree
attributes.additional_details:
British citizen school/college in Portsmouth.
Trained in New Zealand as nurse at University.
Now trying to continue nursing in own country but too many barriers in doing so, due to British council policies in making everyone sit the ielts exam at £150 per time which has NOTHING to do with Nursing. 
UK hospitals screaming out for nurses, something needs to change, I'M ENGLISH and passionate about my nursing.
please share/sign and help if you agree

attributes.action: No blame approach to adoptive parents when disruption occurs
attributes.background: Add a new entry box Children's Act 1989 Part IVsec31: "has complex medical and/or psychological reasons". This is a neutral and no blame approach to the breakdown where parental love and devotion are not the issues when adoption disruption occurs.
attributes.additional_details:
CARE ORDER Form C110A fails to protect natural and adoptive parents whose child is returned to Care for complex medical and/or psychological reasons. As per Children's Act 1989 Part IVsec31, reasons: • not receiving care that would be reasonably expected from a parent, or • is beyond parental control

Add new entry box in Section 4: "has complex medical and/or psychological reasons". This is a neutral and no blame approach to the breakdown where parental love and devotion are not the issues.

attributes.action: Lower car insurance for ages 17-25. No matter on Postcode.
attributes.background: Car insurance for ages 17-25 is ridiculous and it also changes on Postcode.  If you were to be 18 and living on Postcode TW2 it will cost less by around £800 annual for the exact same car than a postcode which is TW13..

attributes.action: Revoke and Repeal the Act of Union 1707 (Treaty of Union)
attributes.background: In 1707 two Acts of Parliament was formed. This is called the 'Treaty of Union'. Revoke that Act to renegotiated and push for separate independent states. ie a 'United England'
attributes.additional_details: The Acts of Union were two Acts of Parliament: the Union with Scotland Act 1706 passed by the Parliament of England, and the Union with England Act passed in 1707 by the Parliament of Scotland. They put into effect the terms of the Treaty of Union that had been agreed on 22 July 1706, following negotiation between commissioners representing the parliaments of the two countries. By the two Acts, the Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of Scotland—which at the time were separate states with separate legislatures, but with the same monarch—were, in the words of the Treaty, "United into One Kingdom by the Name of Great Britain"

attributes.action: Make the 5th of July NHS day, and a national holiday.
attributes.background: I feel that many now, so far on from it's inception truly understand a lot about when and how it started. As a whole, we just take it for granted, and have become blase about it. Yet it's treated all of us, saved lives, including my own, and more than once. It deserves to be celebrated by us all.

attributes.action: Return Sex Education to UK schools and update it for the 21st Century
attributes.background: Due to the recent decision by the education secretary Ms Morgan to remove compulsory sex education from UK schools, we petition & campaign to have it returned to the curriculum & propose it be updated to a wonder view of sexual & relationship education in the 21st Century Age of Information.
attributes.additional_details:
achieving the extraordinary feat of uniting four parliamentary select committees, five teaching unions, the Children’s commissioner, the Chief Medical Officer, the Association of Police and Crime Commissioners, two royal societies and no less than six medical royal colleges. 

Education Secretary Nicky Morgan ruled out making sex education compulsory for all schools. Strange, not just due so many wise and knowledgable people wanted mandatory sex education, but also because Mrs Morgan herself did

attributes.action: Ultra sound scans of ovaries as part of the smear screening process
attributes.background: My name is Sam. I'm a 31 year old mother of 2. I've always stayed up to date with my checks. Having had a baby 8 month ago delivered by c section I had a tender pain in my abdomen still to this day. After being admitted to A&E suspected appendicitis. It turns out I have a 17cm cyst on my ovary
attributes.additional_details:
If it wasn't for the sharp pain I experienced one day. I would never have know about this cyst. I have an appointment now to have a full hysterectomy (my choice as I want no risk of anything returning). As the cyst is classed as suspicious. 
I believe if you arrange for ultra sounds to be done at the same appointment as women having smear tests. We can reduce the risk of other women living with these possibly life threatening undetected growths.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The ‘remain’ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of £5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: Bring an end to zero hour contracts!
attributes.background: Zero hour contracts make it hard for people to save and budget. This can cause a host to many detrimental effects! Under a zero hour contract an employer has no obligation to provide any minimum hours of work leaving employees with worry that they may not be able to feed their family or pay bills.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero hour contracts make it hard for people to save and budget. This can cause a host to many detrimental effects! Under a zero hour contract an employer has no obligation to provide any minimum hours of work leaving employees with worry that they may not be able to feed their family or pay bills on time. 
I would like Parliament to discuss bringing a minimum guaranteed hours scheme or a base pay so people don't have to rely on benefits to see them through.

attributes.action: Review the Child Maintenance system, and the people employed to serve there.
attributes.background: We, resident and non resident parents and carers, believe that the current child maintainance system is not fit for purpose and that it should be reviewed. Service users find that the system is treating them unfairly, that the employees can be unprofessional and that there is maladministration.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/child-maintenance
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maladministration

attributes.action: Make the Speakership a Commons position in its own right, remove his MP status
attributes.background: The Speaker (and the three Deputy Speakers) are not allowed to speak or vote in debates which means that they can't represent their constituents properly. We believe that the Speakers should be staff roles rather than being an MP which effectively disenfranchses 4 constituencies (approx 280k people)
attributes.additional_details: This has been considered before by the Procedure Committee and several times (more in the past) before then ( http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201012/cmselect/cmproced/1573/157305.htm ). But we don't agree with the idea that the Speaker is 'most representative of the popular will' (quoted, 22.) since he is not allowed to express the opinion of his constituents in debate. His ability to speak to Government Ministers is not adequate compensation - since they stick to their views anyway.

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in George Osborne.
attributes.background: George Osborne has consistently failed to meet his own targets thereby proving beyond any shadow of a doubt the level of his incompetence. A vote of no confidence should be sought in an effort to have him removed from his post before he inflicts any further fiscal carnage on the British economy.
attributes.additional_details:
1. The OBR has a gloomier outlook for the future than he does.
2. He will breach his own 'Charter for Budget Responsibility' as the GDP debt ratio rises in the coming year. . again.
3. He will miss his welfare cap target in the coming year... again.
4. His predicted budget surplus in 2019-2020 is more accurately predicted by the OBR as a 3.5bn deficit. His own accountancy on the matter is more based on 'creative assumption' than actual fact.

attributes.action: Ask all MPs to use Email and Twitter to allow their constituents to contact them
attributes.background: We would like all MPs to use email and Twitter to allow their constituents to contact them quickly and easily.  This would make the democratic process accessible to all.

attributes.action: Reopen the railway from Bourne End to Wycombe
attributes.background: The line was closed in the late 1970s but needs to be reopened.

attributes.action: Repeal the decision that forces hospitals to stop providing heart surgery.
attributes.background: Three hospitals in Leicester, Manchester and London have just been ordered to stop surgery on patients born with heart disorders by April 2017. This puts the lives of many patients at risk. Force our government to invest in heart units and not to abandon those, like me, with heart conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If a standard of care is deemed unsatisfactory every effort should be made to raise that standard considerably to save lives. Our government shouldn't be abandoning people with heart disorders and rejecting the phenomenal work of those doctors who strive to provide the best care for their patients. This decision will also force patients and their families to travel great and costly distances. The government is putting lives at an even greater risk by shutting down these services.

attributes.action: Raise The Legal Limit of Stakes For Poker In Pubs To £10 And £20 In Social Clubs
attributes.background:
Current law states: 
Low stakes poker is permitted in pubs so long as stakes are kept to a maximum of £5 per player with a £100 total pot per premises per day 
Low stakes poker in social clubs with the correct gaming permit allows a maximum of £10 per player £250 total pot per premises per day
attributes.additional_details:
We are petitioning to change this law to the following:

Low stakes poker to be permitted in pubs with stakes kept to: £10 Maximum per player with no maximum pot, in social clubs: £20 maximum per player no maximum pot (modify the gaming permit licence)

stake limits should now be raised as inflation no longer reflects the old limits set in the gambling act 2005 and maximum pots size unrestricted

We believe that this change to the law would also benefit all UK pubs who are struggling to survive

attributes.action: Invest an extra £350 million per week in to the NHS
attributes.background: As widely publicised by the leave campaign, the government can afford to spend 350 million pounds on the NHS per week with the money they will now save from EU membership. As a key message in the leave campaign - this should now be implemented. The NHS and the public needs this investment.

attributes.action: Relieve Capita of their contract for assessing disabled people
attributes.background: Relieve Capita of their contract for assessing disabled people on the back of the revelations revealed in the Channel 4 Dispatches program that was aired on the 11th April 2016

attributes.action: Re-open the railway line between Matlock, Bakewell, Buxton and Manchester
attributes.background: We need an efficient and environmentally friendly transport network for the future and increasing reliance on energy hungry private vehicles is poor sense in a world with finite resources. Furthermore reopening this line can only be good for the economy of the local area and bring more tourists.
attributes.additional_details: A feasibility study was carried out in the past and although financially unviable at the time, a decade has now passed and it's a whole different situation. Passenger numbers have grown astronomically, all but one of the stations along the current Derwent Valley Line have seen passenger numbers more than double over this time. Rail travel is also in demand more than ever. Tourism and the local economy would undoubtedly be boosted in the town of Bakewell, as well as other areas the route covers.

attributes.action: No funding for Crossrail 2 until there is equal funding for Northern transport
attributes.background:
Until there is equal per capita funding for transport schemes in the north there should be no more funding for huge schemes in London like Crossrail2.

"HS3" is very small scale, and these plans still concentrate spending in the capital while there are only very minor upgrades for the north.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a huge imbalance in infrastructure spending between North and South, sucking economic activity away from the north. London gets 24 times as much spent on infrastructure per resident than north-east England. 
http://www.theguardian.com/news/datablog/2014/aug/07/london-gets-24-times-as-much-infrastructure-north-east-england

Liverpool has offered to pay £2bn towards the £3bn cost of high speed rail. The government can't find £1bn left for that but has £27-32bn to spend on more for London.

attributes.action: Link time of raising earning threshold for Carers Allowance with the Living wage
attributes.background: Currently earnings after allowable deductions must be no more that £110 pw but because the National Living Wage for over 25s is £7.20hr. This means someone working 16 hrs a week will earn £115.20 per week. £5.20 more than the amount allowed to earn and are at risk of losing their Carer's Allowance
attributes.additional_details:
Unpaid carers save the UK £132 billion a year. For 2015/16, the overall NHS budget was around £116.4 billion. This comparison alone illustrates the net-worth of Carers and their contribution to the economy. It is therefore not unreasonable to suppose the Government values their worth and shows it in a meaningful way.

This petition calls on the Chancellor of the Exchequer to link the time of raising the earnings threshold for Carer's Allowance with that of the Living Wage rise.

attributes.action: Allow PTSD companion dogs to be classed as assistance dogs.
attributes.background: It has been proven that dogs have assisted those suffering from mental health issues. The prime example is that in the USA dogs for military veterans suffering PTSD, have enabled the individual. The fact that this proven and recognized assistance is not recognized here in the UK needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details:
http://journalofethics.ama-assn.org/2015/06/hlaw1-1506.html

http://www.apadivisions.org/division-19/publications/newsletters/military/2015/04/service-dogs.aspx

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/how-dogs-can-help-veterans-overcome-ptsd-137582968/?no-ist

attributes.action: Hallmarks by assay offices located overseas should not be identical to UK marks.
attributes.background: In 2013 the 4 UK Assay Offices were allowed to open up sub-offices in other countries. The intention was that 'offshore' assayed items would carry a different hallmark. Birmingham Assay Office in Mumbai, India are using Birmingham hallmarks identical to the UK marks. This misleads the consumer.

attributes.action: Bring VAT back down to 15% immediately after EU exit has been completed
attributes.background: Give honest working UK tax payers and families a much needed economical boost and shot in the arm. With new global trade deals now possible and a recouped EU membership bill lets force competition in the market place and give the consumer a chance to really contribute to incrrasing overall GDP

attributes.action: We call on the Government to offer anonymity to victims of revenge porn
attributes.background:
Last year the Coalition made it illegal to disclose private sexual photographs and videos with intent to cause distress. 

Offering anonymity to victims empowers them to come forward to get justice. They shouldn't have to suffer in silence to protect any privacy they have left.

attributes.action: Stop the new changes to GCSE which will penalise dyslexic pupils.
attributes.background: Dyslexic pupils can lose 5% of their marks in English literature, geography, history and religious studies due to poor spelling. Why should these pupils be discriminated against because of their disability
attributes.additional_details: Dyslexic experts, educationists and teachers' unions say the new rules on marking, announced by the Department for Education last month, will penalise hundreds of thousands with a genuine spelling disability and make it more difficult for them to reach target grades. A spokesman for Ofqual confirmed there would be no special exemptions from the marking regime for dyslexic pupils.

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid and other schemes until we clear our national debt.
attributes.background: It's high time that the government stopped sending the taxpayers money abroad in foreign aid and other projects. We at home have had so many services cut and our debt is still climbing. All foreign aid and other projects should stop until the uk debt of 1.6 trillion is cleared.

attributes.action: Law Change for the Victim so Paedophiles/Sex Offenders cannot live in same area.
attributes.background: My daughter lives in fear on a daily basis living within close vicinity of the offender.  The offender was already on bail condition in relation to a previous case involving another child. He broke his bail conditions by approaching my daughter at school, by asking for her items of underwear.
attributes.additional_details:
The Law needs to change so that victims no longer live in fear, of seeing their abuser within their home towns.  This will help victims to start regain confidence from fear, and living their lives once more.
This individual has come into your child's life uninvited, caused emotional stress and constant trauma, self-harming, to the point they don't want to live.  My daughters abuser was given 300 hours Community Service, 3 years on the Sex Offenders Register and a Community Payback Order.

attributes.action: protection to domestic violence victims when using the child maintenance service
attributes.background: The new child maintenance service wants to hand over case sensitive information to exs like bank account numbers, this opens up opportunities for you to be traced to the area you live using the sort code, also using the payment to write messages. Leaving domestic violence victims unsafe
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be no protection I myself have court orders that state no direct or indirect contact. I have had police involvement for stalking and harrassment yet this is still not being acknowledged. This is going to place many people and their children in danger and action needs to be taken to protect them

attributes.action: Offer a free phone line for DWP universal credit claims helpline
attributes.background: The government should issue a free helpline phone number for universal credit claimants.

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence for David Cameron
attributes.background: In light of the propsed contracts forced upon junior doctors by Jeremy Hunt, little has been done to counter the source. David Cameron's conservative government should be held acountable for it's attack on the NHS and demorlisation of the United Kingdom. Call for a vote of no confidence.

attributes.action: More support for people underweight (programs/support groups)
attributes.background: I lost a lot of weight and dropped to 5st 4... I see weight watchers and slimming world all over but theirs nothing for people underweight! I am a one woman army trying to get heard. I was in the daily mail with my story now I want to help others!
attributes.additional_details: Theirs 13,000 weight watchers meetings happening every week yet for underweight people there's a hotline to call which is only open for 9 hours!

attributes.action: Make wearing helmets the law for everyone riding a bicycle
attributes.background: Too many children and adults have died, or have been fatally injured, due to head injury, due to not having head protection.

attributes.action: Amend the Broadcasting Act: Enable action against hostile State media
attributes.background: A public enquiry has found evidence of Russian State involvement in the murder of Alexander Litvinenko. Parliament should amend the Broadcasting Act so licences of media directed by a foreign State (such as "RT") are revoked if that State is identified as having sponsored criminal acts in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: A public enquiry has found that there is "strong circumstantial evidence" of Russian State involvement in the murder of Alexander Litvinenko. States that sponsor murder in the UK should not be permitted to influence UK public opinion by broadcasting here. Parliament should amend the Broadcasting Act so the broadcasting licences of media directed by a foreign State (including "RT") are revoked if that State is identified as having committed/sponsored criminal acts in the UK by a court/inquiry."

attributes.action: WCA assessment providers to refund fees if a decision is overturned at tribunal
attributes.background: When assessment providers declare people "fit to work", they rarely consider ESA Regulations 29 and 35. The Work Capability Assessment (WCA) training manual explains these regs but many assessors are unaware of them. This places vulnerable people at risk, e.g. Kenny Bailey
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/man-part-head-missing-who-8037089

I feel that if an appeal is won using these regs when they haven't been considered by an "assessor", then the company is at fault and should not only refund the Government the charge for the assessment (£40-£60 +) but also cover the tribunal fees (£1000+).

attributes.action: Change the law to introduce restrictions on where convicted paedophiles can live
attributes.background: Following recently finding out a paedophile was living on my street, a street not only full of children but also by a primary school. It got me thinking how many more situations are like this and that there should be tighter restrictions to protect children.

attributes.action: Disestablish the Church of England and establish Britain as a secular state
attributes.background: CofE attendance is 765,000, representing 1.4% of England's population. The House of Lords has 26 CofE Bishops who participate in debates and vote in divisions, which involve decisions affecting the entire UK. This is wholly disproportionate to the size of the CofE's attendance and thus influence.

attributes.action: Ban corded blinds! Stop children accidentally dying
attributes.background: To many babies and toddlers have been hurt or died after getting stuck in corded string blinds! They need banning, this should of been done years ago! It's happened to many times. It happened to my friends little girl and others since!

attributes.action: Make Anti-Tattoo Discrimination From Employers Become A Recognised Crime
attributes.background: Tattoos are more popular than ever, but workers can be dismissed from or denied jobs because of their body modifications. We want protection under employment law, That such discrimination should be ruled out, rather than tattooed peopls be ruled out from a potential job.

attributes.action: Educate students about mortgages/taxes/life skills etc in college/high school
attributes.background: Learning about mortgages etc should be compulsory for students as I don't know what it is, how it works etc and I'm in college. This gives the students better skills for life than what is currently taught in their citizenship/pshce lessons

attributes.action: End the Junior Doctor dispute by maintaining a 5-day non-emergency care service.
attributes.background: We the people demand for the Government to end the dispute with Junior Doctors. If the Government is unwilling to find extra resources to fund elective care over 7-days a week they should removed it from their manifesto. We should maintain a 24/7 emergency service and a 5-day non-emergency service.

attributes.action: Introduce a legal ratio of nurse to patient.
attributes.background: Something I have witnessed not only as a Healthcare Assistant but also as a student nurse is the increasing number of patients a Staff Nurse is being forced to care for. The government need to recognise this is wrong and jeopardising patient safety! Make the legal limit 1 Nurse: 8 Patients.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a student nurse who is looking to work for the NHS once I qualify, however, this growing number of patients that Nurses are being made to look after TERRIFIES me! 
There needs to be a limit put in place to safeguard Nurses and patients. It isn't safe to have up to 12 patients to 1 Nurse. 
Avoidable mistakes are being made daily on wards due to low levels of staffing! 
Imagine it was your mother, father, nan or grandad who was admitted to hospital where the Nurse can't give them the best care

attributes.action: Change  'Assaulting a Police Officer' to Assaulting Emergency Services personnel
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted across the country leaving them with severe injurys that stop them from doing the amazing work they do. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Office has for many years.
attributes.additional_details: Across the news the past month, story's are arising of emergency services Personel being assaulted while carrying out the jobs. Ambulance staff that are there to treat and help people are being assaulted leaving them with serious injurys that stop them from working. The law should be changed to help combat the disgusting behaviour that is being seen across the country.

attributes.action: Regulate political campaign material and communications
attributes.background:
In the most recent UK referendum on membership of the EU, campaign materials & messages on both sides contained gross mistruths, irregularities and exaggeration.

Citizens must be able to rely on campaign messages which are clear, factual and informative so that we can submit fully informed votes
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral Commission regulates a lot of the process around elections & voting, but there is currently no regulation from any body on political campaign materials and messages. I propose that the EC's remit is extended to regulate this as well. This would enable the voting public to execute their democratic right in a fully informed way. As to ask people to make an important choice on anything other than independently-verified facts & information runs the risk of destabilising our democracy.

attributes.action: Bring back acident and emergency to high wycombe
attributes.background: Bring it back to high wycombe

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time. This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods.

The proposed Benefit would be funded by introducing a levy of 50% of UK Profits on companies who move their operations - in whole or in part - outside the UK.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to create a new regulatory body for the security industry
attributes.background: The Security Industry Authority (SIA) has fundamentally failed to implement the correct training standards for the security industry by omitting vital training objectives necessary for private security to work effectively in the work place.
attributes.additional_details: We want the UK Government to recognise the current dangerous and unfit for purpose standards currently imposed on the industry by the SIA and to create a new statutory regulatory body comprising of experienced security industry professionals dedicated to implementing a proper workable fit for purpose training standard that is transparent, impartial and independent.

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there
